str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and histemi; to place down, i.e. to designate, constitute, convoy.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.
A gift, present. A present; specially, a sacrifice.
Abstr. and concr: sacrifice; a sacrifice, offering. From thuo; sacrifice.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
